selected_quotes: Wow! Cephalopod's reflective proteins maybe were horizontally transferred from bacteria!
El gen que controla la reflectina (proteïna responsable del canvi del color dels cefalòpodes) és d'origen bacterià
Cephalopods must restrain their coolness, it's too much at this point
HGT from V. fischeri to squid host? Tantalizing idea, but data seem thin: 90% nucleotide identity across 24 bp.
So this is kinda weird: Origin of the Reflectin Gene and Hierarchical Assembly of Its Protein #feedly

citation.abstract: Cephalopods, the group of animals including octopus, squid, and cuttlefish, have remarkable ability to instantly modulate body coloration and patterns so as to blend into surrounding environments [1, 2] or send warning signals to other animals [3]. Reflectin is expressed exclusively in cephalopods, filling the lamellae of intracellular Bragg reflectors that exhibit dynamic iridescence and structural color change [4]. Here, we trace the possible origin of the reflectin gene back to a transposon from the symbiotic bioluminescent bacterium Vibrio fischeri and report the hierarchical structural architecture of reflectin protein. Intrinsic self-assembly, and higher-order assembly tightly modulated by aromatic compounds, provide insights into the formation of multilayer reflectors in iridophores and spherical microparticles in leucophores and may form the basis of structural color change in cephalopods. Self-assembly and higher-order assembly in reflectin originated from a core repeating octapeptide (here named protopeptide), which may be from the same symbiotic bacteria. The origin of the reflectin gene and assembly features of reflectin protein are of considerable biological interest. The hierarchical structural architecture of reflectin and its domain and protopeptide not only provide insights for bioinspired photonic materials but also serve as unique "assembly tags" and feasible molecular platforms in biotechnology.
citation.title: Origin of the Reflectin Gene and Hierarchical Assembly of Its Protein

news.title: Research group discovers the origin of octopuses' instant modulation of body coloration
news.summary: Home Biology Plants & Animals September 11, 2017 September 11, 2017 by Zhou Yijing Cephalopods, the group of animals including octopus, squid, and cuttlefish, are famous for their remarkable ability to modulate body coloration and patterns instantly.
